p: It should also be noted that C. sativa L. seeds, particularly those of the hemp variety, typically have nutritional value. The seed is made up of approximately 25% high-quality protein and 35% fat [ 49]. Table 7 below lists some vitamins, minerals and macronutrients found in C. sativa L. seeds. In addition to significant concentrations of fatty acids (particularly omega-6 fatty acids), hemp oil extracted from C. sativa L. seeds also contain vitamin C [ 50, 51]; thiamine [ 50, 51]; riboflavin [ 50, 51]; vitamin E [ 50, 51]; minerals such as calcium [ 50], magnesium [ 50, 51], potassium [ 50, 51], phosphorus [ 50, 51], iron [ 50, 51], zinc [ 50, 51], sodium [ 50, 51], and copper [ 51]; and macronutrients such as fat [ 50], carbohydrates [ 50], fiber [ 50], and protein [ 50].
